00073 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00074 
00075 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00076 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00077 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00078 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00079 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00080 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00081 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00082 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00083 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00084 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)
00085 
00086 typedef struct {
00087 
00088     volatile unsigned long lock;
00089 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00090     const char *file;
00091     const char *function;
00092     unsigned line;
00093     int cpu;
00094 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00095 } xnlock_t;
00096 
00097 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00098 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) { 0 }
00099 #else
00100 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00101         0,                                      \
00102         NULL,                                   \
00103         0,                                      \
00104         -1                                      \
00105         }
00106 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00107 
00108 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00109 
00110 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00111 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00112 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00113 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00114     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00115 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00116 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00117 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00118 
00119 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00120 
00121     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00122 }
00123 
00124 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00125 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00126 
00127 static inline spl_t
00128 __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock, const char *file, unsigned line, const char *function)
00129 {
00130     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00131 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00132 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00133 {
00134 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00135     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00136     unsigned long flags;
00137 
00138     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00139 
00140     adeos_load_cpuid();
00141 
00142     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00143         {
00144         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00145             {
00146             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00147 
00148 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00149             if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00150                 {
00151                 adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current);
00152                 printk(KERN_ERR
00153                        "RTAI: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00154                        "      waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00155                        "      owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00156                        lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00157                        lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00158                 show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00159                 for (;;)
00160                     safe_halt();
00161                 }
00162 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00163             }
00164 
00165 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00166         lock->file = file;
00167         lock->function = function;
00168         lock->line = line;
00169         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00170 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00171         }
00172     else
00173         flags |= 2;
00174 
00175     return flags;
00176 }
00177 
00178 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00179 
00180 {
00181     if (!(flags & 2))
00182         {
00183         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00184 
00185         rthal_cli();
00186 
00187         adeos_load_cpuid();
00188 
00189         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00190             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00191         }
00192 
00193     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00194 }
00195 
00196 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00197 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00198 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00199 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00200 
00201 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00202 
00203 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00204 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00205 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00206 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00207 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00208 
00209 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00213 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00214 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00215 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00216 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00217    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00218    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but rather an APIC-based
00219    timer interrupt instead. */
00220 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00221 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00222 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00223 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00224 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) (x)

00266 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00267 
00268     /* Kernel mode side */
00269     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00270     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00271     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00272     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00273     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00274 
00275     /* User mode side */
00276     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00277     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00278 
00279     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00280     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00281     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00282 
00283 } xnarchtcb_t;
00284

00290 
00291 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;

00293 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)  ((fi)->vector)
00294 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)  ((fi)->errcode)
00295 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)    ((fi)->regs->eip)

00297 typedef struct xnarch_heapcb {
00298 
00299     atomic_t numaps;    /* # of active user-space mappings. */
00300 
00301     int kmflags;        /* Kernel memory flags (0 if vmalloc()). */
00302 
00303     void *heapbase;     /* Shared heap memory base (possibly unaligned). */
00304 
00305     void *shmbase;      /* Shared memory base (page-aligned). */
00306 
00307 } xnarch_heapcb_t;
00308 
00309 static inline void xnarch_init_heapcb (xnarch_heapcb_t *hcb)
00310 
00311 {
00312     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00313     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00314     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00315     hcb->shmbase = NULL;
00316 }

00322 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00323     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00324 }
00325 
00326 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00327     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00328 }
00329 
00330 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00331     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00332 }
00333 
00334 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00335     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00336 }
00337 
00338 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00339     return adeos_processor_id();
00340 }
00341 
00342 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00343 
00344 {
00345     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00346         return vmalloc(bytes);
00347 
00348     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00349 }
00350 
00351 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00352 
00353 {
00354     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00355         vfree(chunk);
00356     else
00357         kfree(chunk);
00358 }

00362 #define xnarch_put_cpu(flags) adeos_put_cpu(flags)

00364 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00365 do { \
00366     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00367     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00368     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00369     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00370 } while(0)

00373 #define xnarch_free_stack  xnfree

00375 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00376 
00377 {
00378     spl_t s;
00379     splhigh(s);
00380     splexit(!!imask);
00381     return !!s;
00382 }

00384 #ifdef XENO_INTR_MODULE
00385 
00386 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00387                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00388                                                    void *cookie),
00389                                    void *cookie)
00390 {
00391     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00392 
00393     if (!err)
00394         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00395 
00396     return err;
00397 }
00398 
00399 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00400 
00401     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00402 }
00403 
00404 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00405 
00406 {
00407     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00408         return -EINVAL;
00409 
00410     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00411 
00412     return 0;
00413 }
00414 
00415 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00416 
00417 {
00418     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00419         return -EINVAL;
00420 
00421     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00422 
00423     return 0;
00424 }
00425 
00426 static inline void xnarch_isr_chain_irq (unsigned irq) {
00427     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);
00428 }
00429 
00430 static inline void xnarch_isr_enable_irq (unsigned irq) {
00431     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00432 }
00433 
00434 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00435 
00436     rthal_pend_linux_irq(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00437 }

00440                                                  cpumask_t affinity) {
00441     return adeos_set_irq_affinity(irq,affinity);
00442 }

00444 #endif /* XENO_INTR_MODULE */

00447 
00448 void xnpod_welcome_thread(struct xnthread *);
00449

00451 
00452 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00453 
00454 {
00455 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00456     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00457 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00458     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00459        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00460        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00461        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00462        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00463        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00464     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00465 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00466 }
00467 
00468 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00469                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00470     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00471 }
00472 
00473 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00474 
00475 {
00476     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00477 
00478     adeos_load_cpuid();
00479 
00480     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00481        and always inside a critical section. */
00482     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00483     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00484     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00485     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00486     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00487 }
00488 
00489 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00490     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00491 }
00492 
00493 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00494                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00495                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00496                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00497                                     )
00498 {
00499 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00500 
00501     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00502         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00503         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00504         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00505         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00506         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00507         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00508         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00509         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00510         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00511         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00512         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00513         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00514         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00515         "ret\n\t" \
00516 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00517         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00518         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00519       : /* no output */ \
00520       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00521         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00522         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00523         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00524         "b" (out_tcb), \
00525         "S" (in_tcb), \
00526         "a" (outproc), \
00527         "d" (inproc));
00528 
00529 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00530 
00531     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00532     
00533     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00534         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00535         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00536         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00537         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00538         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00539         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00540         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00541         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00542         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00543         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00544         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00545         "ret\n\t" \
00546 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00547       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00548         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00549         "=S" (esi_out), \
00550         "=D" (edi_out), \
00551         "+a" (outproc), \
00552         "+d" (inproc) \
00553       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00554         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00555         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00556         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00557 
00558 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00559 }
00560 
00561 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00562                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00563 {
00564     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00565     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00566 
00567     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)        
00568         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so that the ts
00569            bit need to be cleared. */
00570         clts();
00571     
00572     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00573 
00574     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00575         {
00576         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00577 
00578         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00579 
00580         if (!inproc->mm)
00581             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00582         }
00583 
00584     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00585 
00586     stts();
00587 }
00588 
00589 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00590                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00591     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00592 }
00593 
00594 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00595     /* Empty */
00596 }
00597 
00598 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00599                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00600                                          const char *name)
00601 {
00602     tcb->user_task = current;
00603     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00604     tcb->esp = 0;
00605     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00606     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00607     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00608 }
00609 
00610 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00611 
00612     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00613     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00614     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00615     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00616     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00617     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00618 }
00619 
00620 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00621                                                int imask,
00622                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00623                                                void *cookie)
00624 {
00625     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00626     stts();
00627     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00628     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00629     entry(cookie);
00630     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00631 }
00632 
00633 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00634                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00635                                        void *cookie,
00636                                        int imask,
00637                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00638                                        char *name)
00639 {
00640     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00641 
00642     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00643     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00644     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00645     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00646     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00647     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00648     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00649     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00650     *--(*psp) = 0;
00651 }
00652 
00653 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00654 
00655 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00656 
00657 {
00658     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00659        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00660 
00661     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00662 
00663     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00664         {
00665         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00666         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00667         }
00668 }
00669 
00670 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00671 
00672 {
00673     if (!tcb->user_task) /* __switch_to() will take care otherwise. */
00674         {
00675         clts();
00676 
00677         if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00678             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00679         else
00680             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00681         }
00682 }
00683 
00684 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00685 
00686 {
00687     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00688 
00689     if (task)
00690         {
00691         if (!task->used_math)
00692             {
00693             stts();
00694             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00695             }
00696 
00697         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00698            hardware. */
00699         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00700         }
00701 
00702     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00703        user-space or kernel thread. */
00704 
00705     clts();
00706 
00707     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00708         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00709     else
00710         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00711 }
00712 
00713 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00714 
00715 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00716 
00717 {}
00718 
00719 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00720 
00721 {}
00722 
00723 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00724 
00725 {}
00726 
00727 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00728 
00729 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00730 
00731     while (!*flagp)
00732         {
00733         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00734         schedule_timeout(1);
00735         }
00736 }

00740 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00741 
00742     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00743 }
00744 
00745 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00746 
00747 {
00748     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00749                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00750                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00751                                      NULL,
00752                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00753 }
00754 
00755 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00756 
00757 {
00758     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00759                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00760                                      NULL,
00761                                      NULL,
00762                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00763 }
00764 
00765 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00766 
00767 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00768 {
00769     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00770 }
00771 
00772 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00773     
00774 {
00775     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00776     cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00777     unsigned long flags;
00778     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00779 
00780     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00781 
00782     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00783        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00784        context. */
00785     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00786                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00787 
00788     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00789     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00790     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00791     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00792 
00793     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00794         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00795     
00796     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00797                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00798 }
00799 
00800 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00801 
00802 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00803 
00804     return 0;
00805 }
00806 
00807 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00808 
00809     return 0;
00810 }
00811 
00812 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00813 
00814     return 0;
00815 }
00816 
00817 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00818 
00819 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00820 
00821 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00822 
00823 {
00824 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00825     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00826        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00827     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00828 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00829 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00830     xnshadow_release_events();
00831 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00832     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00833     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00834     schedule_timeout(50);
00835     xnarch_release_ipi();
00836 }
00837 
00838 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00839 
00840 {
00841     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00842 
00843     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00844         {
00845         spl_t s;
00846         splsync(s);
00847         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00848         splexit(s);
00849         return 1;
00850         }
00851 
00852     return 0;
00853 }
00854 
00855 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00856 
00857 {
00858 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00859     xnshadow_grab_events();
00860 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00861 }
00862 
00863 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00864 
00865 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00866 
00867 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00868                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00869                                            const char *name)
00870 {
00871     struct task_struct *task = current;
00872 
00873     tcb->user_task = task;
00874     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00875     tcb->esp = 0;
00876     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00877     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00878     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00879 }
00880 
00881 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00882 
00883 {
00884     unsigned irq;
00885 
00886     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00887         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00888                              handler,
00889                              NULL,
00890                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00891 }
00892 
00893 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00894 
00895 {
00896     unsigned irq;
00897 
00898     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00899         {
00900         switch (irq)
00901             {
00902 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00903             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00904             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00905             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00906             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00907 
00908                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00909                 continue;
00910 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00911 
00912             default:
00913 
00914                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00915             }
00916         }
00917 }
00918 
00919 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00920 
00921 {
00922     unsigned irq;
00923 
00924     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00925         {
00926         switch (irq)
00927             {
00928 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00929             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00930             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00931             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00932             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00933 
00934                 continue;
00935 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00936 
00937             default:
00938 
00939                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00940             }
00941         }
00942 }
00943 
00944 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00946 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00947 
00948 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00949     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00950        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00951        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. */ 
00952     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00953 }
00954 
00955 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00956     rthal_release_timer();
00957 }
00958 
00959 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00960                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00961                                         unsigned long long defval)
00962 {
00963 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00964     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00965     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00966     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00967 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00968     *shot = defval;
00969     *delivery = defval;
00970 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00971 }
00972 
00973 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00974 
00975 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00976 
00977 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00978 
00979 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00980 
00981 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00982 
00983 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00984 
00985 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00986 {
00987     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00988 
00989     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00990     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00991     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00992 
00993     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00994 }
00995 
00996 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00997 
00998 {
00999     int err = 0;
01000 
01001 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
01002     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
01003        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
01004     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
01005 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
01006 
01007     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
01008 
01009     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
01010         return -ENOSYS;
01011 
01012     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
01013                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
01014                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
01015                               NULL,
01016                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
01017 
01018     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
01019 
01020 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01021     err = xnshadow_mount();
01022 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01023 
01024     if (err)
01025         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01026 
01027     return err;
01028 }
01029 
01030 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
01031 
01032 {
01033 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01034     xnshadow_cleanup();
01035 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01036     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01037     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01038 }
01039 
01040 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
01041 
01042 #ifdef XENO_TRACES_MODULE
01043 
01044 #include <asm/timex.h>          /* For cpu_khz */
01045 #include <linux/kernel_stat.h>  /* For kstat_irqs */
01046 
01047 #if CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
01048 
01049 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI
01050 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (irq_stat[(cpu)].apic_timer_irqs)
01051 
01052 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01053 
01054 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_8254_IRQ
01055 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (kstat_cpu(cpu).irqs[RTHAL_8254_IRQ])
01056 
01057 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01058 
01059 #define tsc2ms(timestamp)          rthal_ulldiv((timestamp), cpu_khz, NULL)
01060 
01061 #endif /* XENO_TRACES_MODULE */
